newsitem.title: USA: Kansas winter wheat condition declines slightly.
newsitem.headline: Kansas winter wheat condition declines slightly.

text.p: Kansas winter wheat condition at the end of January was rated in slightly lower condition than it was at the end of December, the state's agricultural statistics service said Monday.

"A continued lack of significant precipitation and lack of snow cover during periods of extreme cold temperatures has impacted the crop," the service said in its crop weather report, which is released monthly during the winter.

Northwest and west central areas of the state had shown the most decline in condition. Damage from blowing wind has generally been light but dry surface moisture has created a potential blowing problem for most of the western half of the state.

Winter wheat condition was rated 10 percent excellent, 65 good, 22 fair and three percent poor. That compared to 16 percent excellent, 66 good, 17 fair and one percent poor at the beginning of January.
Topsoil moisture was rated three percent surplus, 67 adequate, 26 short and four percent very short.
The report said cattle have withstood the cold weather fairly well because of the dry conditions.
